title: Microsoft Windows NtUserMagSetContextInformation Kernel State Corruption Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on vulnerable installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of the NtUserMagSetContextInformation system call. By supplying specific arguments, an attacker can cause corruption of kernel state. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code under the context of SYSTEM.
addtionnal_details: Microsoft has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/MS16-135
timeline:
2016-09-16 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2016-11-08 - Coordinated public release of advisory
